results.title: Homecoming
results.creator_credit: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite the horrors of fighting in the Vietnam War, Grant Coultman-Smith and his fellow soldiers were unprepared for the reception when they returned to Australia. Rejected by the people, the Returned Services League and even the Government, Grant and his colleagues found comfort and support in each other as they fought the psychological effects of war and achieving greater recognition for their service in the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Correspondence
results.creator_credit: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon White, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.
description_for_label: Despite being born on Friday the 13th, Gordon White was always considered to be lucky. With luck on his side, he joined the Australian Navy and spent most of his time on the HMAS Sydney, a battleship that had survived 80-90 bombing raids with no loss of life. When he was posted on another ship, Gordon soon realised that downside to being lucky - witnessing the suffering of others.

results.title: Traditions
results.creator_credit: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Conscription brought Con Bell into World War II. Regardless of how he entered the war, Con is proud of the part he played in the development of a new army tradition. A member of the first permanent commando squadrons, he reflects on how this experience has shaped the man he is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Triptych
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Walter Bird and ACMI
results.brief_description: Walter Bird recalls a time when he was asked “Where are you from?”, and answered by describing where his house was situated in the neighbourhood. Growing up, he started to learn the implications of that question. He realised that he was ethnically different from other Australian-born children. Being the child of immigrants, Walter weighs up the positives and negatives of being a first generation Australian and shares his experiences when he finally travelled to his parents’ countries.

results.title: The Invisible net
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sarah Vincent and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sarah Vincent looks at 2008, a year of immense ups and downs, and, in particular, when she was diagnosed with cancer. Rather than dwelling on the treatment and anxiety, Sarah chooses to focus on the amazing support she received from her community of family, friends, the school and neighbours. Through their support, Sarah learned to count her blessings and credits cancer with changing her outlook on life.

results.title: Old life, new life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Raelanah Loloa and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Raelanah Loloa, moving from the town where she grew up in New Zealand to start a new life in Australia was an experience both exciting and stressful. It was hard leaving all her friends and trying to make new ones but, eventually, Raelanah and her family were able to build a new life in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Raelanah Loloa and ACMI

results.title: From fear to success
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Phillip Martinovski and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Phillip Martinovski had to go to Copperfield’s senior campus, he was incredibly nervous, so much so that on the first day he spent a lot of time standing outside the gates, debating whether to ‘wag’. In the end, he threw himself him and talks about his time at Copperfield College Senior School, in the hope that he can students like him overcome their fears.

results.title: Change
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Michelle Huynh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Huynh’s high school years were peppered with having to change schools. In that, she had to adjust to a new area, and more importantly, make new friends. In time, Michelle has learnt to see the changes she dreaded so much as a good thing.

results.title: Never give up
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Haris Fazlic and ACMI
results.brief_description: Haris Fazlic got sick of being larger than his classmates and took up exercising and, eventually, discovered his passion for wrestling. This passion has driven him to win many times despite having to overcome a major obstacle on the way. Wrestling has taught Haris that you should never give up on something you love, no matter what.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Haris Fazlic and ACMI
results.description: Haris Fazlic got sick of being larger than his classmates and took up exercising and, eventually, discovered his passion for wrestling. This passion has driven him to win many times despite having to overcome a major obstacle on the way. Wrestling has taught Haris that you should never give up on something you love, no matter what.
